etymologies: late 17th century: from French grosbec, from gros ‘big, fat’ + bec ‘beak’

definitions: a finch or related songbird with a stout conical bill and typically brightly colored plumage.

notes.text: Several genera in the family Fringillidae and subfamily Cardinalinae (family Emberizidae); the white-fronted grosbeak or grosbeak weaver (Amblyospiza albifrons) belongs to the family Ploceidae

shortDefinitions: finch or related songbird with stout conical bill
